title: Google lets personal users stay on ‘no-cost Legacy G Suite’ with custom Gmail domain
content:
Back in April, Google delayed when G Suite legacy free-edition users had to start paying for Workspace. The company will now let you stay on a “Free Legacy Edition of G Suite for personal use” as the “no-cost” alternative in a rather notable policy change.

more…

The post Google lets personal users stay on ‘no-cost Legacy G Suite’ with custom Gmail domain appeared first on 9to5Google.
description: Google's waitlist for the "no-cost" legacy option that moves your existing G Suite account to a Gmail address is now open....
